etymology.description: semantic 木(木) (mù, "tree") + phonetic 容(容) (róng, "contain") = wood-related and pronounced as róng -> banyan
etymology.interpretation: The character 榕(róng, "banyan") combines 木(mù, "tree") as the semantic component indicating relation to trees and nature with 容(róng, "contain") to suggest the sound, producing a character referring to a specific type of large, spreading tree known for its extensive branches.

examples.chinese: 榕树是热带雨林的重要组成部分(榕樹是熱帶雨林的重要組成部分)。
examples.pinyin: Róngshù shì rèdài yǔlín de zhòngyào zǔchéng bùfèn.
examples.english: The banyan is an important part of the tropical rainforest.

examples.chinese: 夏日里榕树下乘凉(夏日裡榕樹下乘涼)，学童们嬉戏玩耍(學童們嬉戲玩耍)。
examples.pinyin: Xiàrì lǐ róngshù xià chéngliáng, xuétóngmen xīxì wánshuǎ.
examples.english: On a summer day, children cool off beneath the banyan while playing happily.

examples.chinese: 古老的榕树庇护着小镇(古老的榕樹庇護著小鎮)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔlǎo de róngshù bìhù zhe xiǎozhèn.
examples.english: The ancient banyan shelters the small town.
